intro: Aspidonepsis, commonly known as the rock cress, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Brassicaceae. These plants are typically small herbs with alternate, pinnately lobed leaves. They produce small, yellow or white flowers arranged in racemes, which are characteristic of the mustard family. Aspidonepsis species are often found in rocky or calcareous soils, thriving in dry, sunny environments. The genus includes several species, some of which are used in traditional medicine or horticulture.
